page.title: 11Residential Centre, Grafham.
page.content: The Centre was purpose-built in 1969 with residential accommodation for 54 students in single, double bunked or eight bedded rooms. Changing values , attitudes and advances in technology have all influenced the development of the programme offered by the centre. Equally the economic climate necessitated an increase in revenue. This would have been best met by the expansion of the adult education and training courses. However, the nature of the accommodation, dormitory sleeping and the lack of classroom and seminar working space has not seen the necessary increase in bookings and therefore it is felt that to meet the requirements of the 80's there must be further development of the centre.
